summary: H.R. 183, titled the "Law Enforcement Officer Recreation Pass Act," proposes an amendment to the Federal Lands Recreation Enhancement Act. The bill would require the federal government to provide a lifetime National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Pass at no cost to all qualified law enforcement officers. The definition is broad, including federal, state, local, and tribal officers who are authorized to prevent, detect, or investigate criminal violations or supervise sentenced offenders. This act would grant these officers free, lifelong access to national parks and other federal recreational areas for them and their passengers.
